contentrichtext.text: '''Quakake Creek''' is a {{convert|12.0|mi|km|adj=mid|-long}}<ref name=NHD>U.S. Geological Survey. National Hydrography Dataset high-resolution flowline data. [http://viewer.nationalmap.gov/viewer/ The National Map], accessed April 1, 2011</ref> [[tributary]] of [[Black Creek (Lehigh River)|Black Creek]] in [[Carbon County, Pennsylvania|Carbon County]], [[Pennsylvania]]. Quakake Creek ([[Native Americans in the United States|Native American]] for "pine woods") joins Black Creek near the borough of [[Weatherly, Pennsylvania|Weatherly]], approximately {{convert|4.3|mi}} upstream of the [[Lehigh River]]. ==See also== *[[List of rivers of Pennsylvania]] ==References== {{Reflist}} *Gertler, Edward. ''Keystone Canoeing'', Seneca Press, 2004. ISBN 0-9749692-0-6 {{coord missing|Pennsylvania}} [[Category:Tributaries of the Lehigh River]] [[Category:Rivers of Pennsylvania]] [[Category:Geography of Carbon County, Pennsylvania]] {{CarbonPA-geo-stub}}
